alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson; Monroe (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 7:47PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, central Jackson and Monroe Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 746 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greenwood to near North Bend. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Greenwood around 750 PM CDT. Loyal around 800 PM CDT. Cataract around 805 PM CDT. Millston and Fort Mc Coy around 820 PM CDT. Tomah around 835 PM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 between mile markers 113 and 147. Interstate 90/94 between mile markers 46 and 52. Interstate 90 in Wisconsin between mile markers 21 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
